result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas H.L. Barfell

10:29 AM Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised by SPD, no attorney appointed at this point, will adjourn, advises to continue to contact SPD, sets for another AIA and continues bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:32 AM Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no attorney from SPD yet. Barfell states he contacted them this morning. Court continues bond, keep in contact with SPD, set for another AIA. Barfell states he filed a motion yesterday. Court has that motion, cannot address that until he has an attorney and explains when a speedy trial demand can be made. Court sets for AIA on 10/12/22 at 10:15 AM. Barfell asks for bond reduction. Court reviews file. State objects to any reduction in bond. Court continues bond. Barfell states he now has a job. Court instructs to let SPD know that as he may no longer be eligible for SPD, given court appointed form in Court as well.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell in court. Court recalled from this morning, believes defendant's girlfriend called yesterday to adjourn, today called because car broke down and questions defendant. Barfell makes statement, broke down in Pulaski, were in Green Bay, unable to find ride, had job interviews in GB. Court reviews file, is eligible for SPD. Barfell indicates they are still looking for attorney. Court will cancel warrant, sets aside forfeiture and reinstates bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas H.L. Barfell
Current: P.O. Box 280, 5363 Linden Street, Laona, WI 54541 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2022)
Prior: P.O. Box 280, Laona, WI 54541 United States

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court has Clerk put on the record the conversation that the Clerk of Court's Office with Wendy Owens as it relates to her court appearance and the defendant's appearance (asked for an adjournment yesterday - Clerk's Office denies that, Owens called this morning stating that their car broke down and again asked for an adjournment stating that they moved to Green Bay). Court finds that the excuses stated by Ms. Owens is a scam to the Court and will not accept it, also notes that the case indicates that Ms. Owen and Mr. Barfell reside in Laona and neither party has updated the Court/DA's office of a change in address which is in violation of their bond conditions. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted - bench warrant body or $1,000.00. Court so orders.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Barfell has complaint, stated he talked to SPD yesterday and do not have anyone for him yet. Court has verification if that in the file. Barfell asks for court appointed attorney as it is taking too long to find an SPD attorney. Court explains that need a little more time to allow them time to appoint an attorney. Barfell asks for a bail reduction. Court reviews bond. State - bond - no objections to reducing bond to $500.00 cash. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $500.00 cash and remainder can be refunded to poster (Wendy Owens), keep in constant contact with SPD, sets for AIA on
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court puts in the record that it did receive correspondence from the defendant (motion to suppress evidence and brief in support of motion and correspondence) all coming from Winnebago County Jail - release date is 6/9/22 and defendant wants to appear in person. Court will continue bond, sets for AIA on 6/15/22 at 11:30 AM - send to the address on the most recent correspondence from the defendant.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Thomas H.L. Barfell appears by video, in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Barfell has received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Barfell does not understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Barfell has had someone on the outside trying to contact an attorney, will be hiring an attorney but is pro se right now, questions charges on complaint. Court advises of options of obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed if not eligible. Barfell will not provide court with address or phone number. State asks for bond to continue. Barfell makes statement regarding charges. Court explains the procedure. Court continues bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Cash set
